body:
### Describe the bug

We are using AWS ECR for our code build it's was worked fine last week but two days before when I tried I faced issue in pip-sync.

Environment : python:3.9.13-alpine3.15

## Error Message



#11 39.93 Collecting pylbfgs==0.2.0.13 (from -r /tmp/tmp0fgk2vts (line 149))

796 | #11 46.78     raise CalledProcessError(retcode, process.args,
797 | #11 46.78 subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['/usr/local/bin/python', '-m', 'pip', 'install', '-r', '/tmp/tmp0fgk2vts']' returned non-zero exit status 1.

### OS

image: python:3.9.13-alpine3.15

comment_data.body: That formatting is horrible, what happened to the indents? In any case the issue is being dealt with in the upstream package, see dedupeio/pylbfgs#38. They will release a hotfix to pin `cython<3.0`, so I think this can be closed here.

Hello @mattip 

Thanks for your guidance, My doubt is why Cython 3.0 is not compatible with pylbfgs?

Cython 3.0 isn't compatible because we've changed the default behaviour of cdef functions to be able to propagate exceptions. This means that you can't assign them to a function point where the function pointer expects a function that won't propagate exceptions.

This is by design. We're going to improve the error message a little in the next release I think to give a bit more guidance.

The solution is likely to add `noexcept` to functions that are used as pointers.

I'll post this in the PyLBFGS issue.

title: Incompatibility for PyLBFGS
